data.title: From Eibenstock to the Auersberg
data.meta_description: This tour takes us via the "Dam of Peace" to the Auersberg, from whose lookout tower we can enjoy one of the most comprehensive views in the entire Ore Mountains.
data.text:
We start our tour at the tourist information in Eibenstock. We walk along Schönheider Straße in the direction of Postplatz and turn left onto turn left onto Karlsbader Straße. We follow the road until in until the Auerbergstraße branches off to the left in a right-hand bend. we change. Follow the road out of the town. From Auerbergstraße becomes Nonnenhausweg, which leads us into the forest. into the forest. In the forest, our path bends to the right and after a short straight section and after a short, straight stretch, the forest thins out on the left and we we look out onto a meadow. Turn left here and then left again at the T-junction. turn left again. Now we enter the forest again.

After a while, our path curves to the right and a little later crosses another path a little later. In the further course another path branches off path branches off to the right and finally we turn left to the Sosa left to the Sosa dam, which provides drinking water for the western Ore Mountains and protects against flooding.

After enjoying the view, we return a little way along the path we came from. the way we came, before we turn left and walk parallel to the reservoir in parallel to the reservoir in a southerly direction. Twice we cross other paths cross ours, until finally a path branches off to the right, almost at a 90° angle, which runs straight through the forest. We follow this path until we reach a crossroads. Here we continue to the left on a very straight path that leads directly to the Auersberg (1018 m). Auersberg (1018 m). There are a few metres to climb to the summit but the effort is worth it. At the top we have the opportunity to climb the lookout tower and enjoy one of the most of the most comprehensive views in the entire Ore Mountains. From there not only the heights of the Ore Mountains and the Vogtland, but and Vogtland heights, but on a clear day you can see as far as the Ochsenkopf in the Fichtelgebirge (80 km) or even as far as the Monument to the Battle of the Nations in Leipzig (100 km).

When we have recovered from the ascent, we head down via the snake trail down to the former hammer mill community of Wildenthal. Once we reach the bottom, we have almost 300 metres of altitude behind us. In the village follow the signs to the Kneipp facility on Ehrethausweg. Here our feet have feet have earned a cooling bath in the clear mountain water and can and can recover before the last short but steep ascent, which brings us to Frühbusser Straße. We turn around on this road, road, which follows the course of the former salt pass, and after about and after about 1.5 km turn left towards Konrads Ruh.
